page.title: 12RACING STABLES, KINGSCLERE
page.content: { Park House Stables}were built in 1885. The present trainer is Mr. Ian Balding. There are a hundred {racehorses}and hunters to be looked after. There are four yards, of different ages, and in one of them is a statue of Mill Reef who was trained here in the 1970's; he was a Derby winner, and his descendants are still being trained at Park House. Horses are bred at the stables, and they begin their training when they are between 16 and 18 months old.Their names are given by their owners, and some have very strange names. The horses are taken out each day, often to the gallops on top of the downs. Sometimes they use a swimming pool which is 14 feet deep. After going swimming they go on an exerciser to help cool them. Sixty-five people work at the stables.
